intro: Bionia acuminata, commonly known as the sharp-pointed bionia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in sandy or rocky soils. The plant features upright stems with lance-shaped leaves that have a slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are small, clustered in dense inflorescences, and typically have five petals. Bionia acuminata is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along coastal areas.
